intro: Pilosocereus urbanianus, commonly known as the Mexican moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive red or orange tubercles that cover its green stem, giving it a unique appearance. The plant belongs to the Cactaceae family and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions. It produces small, white flowers during the warm season, which are followed by red fruits. Pilosocereus urbanianus is a popular ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
